hero_subtitle: Build native UIs for iOS, Android, and Web with a single JSON definition
code_example_subtitle: Define your UI once in JSON, deploy everywhere
feature_write_once_desc: Single JSON definition works across all platforms
footer_copyright: Copyright © 2025 TANOSYS, LLC. Built with ReactJsonUI.
learn_subtitle: Master cross-platform UI development with JSON
learn_getting_started_desc: Set up your first JsonUI project in minutes
learn_installation_desc: Install JsonUI for your target platform
learn_quick_start_desc: Build your first UI component with JSON
learn_json_basics_desc: Learn the fundamentals of JsonUI syntax
learn_styling_desc: Apply styles and create reusable themes
learn_data_binding_desc: Connect your UI to data sources
learn_advanced_desc: Master Include system and custom components
learn_tutorial_subtitle: Learn the basics of JsonUI in 3 simple steps
learn_step1_desc: Every UI starts with a View container. Views can hold other components and define layout direction.
learn_step2_desc: Add buttons and handle user interactions with onClick handlers.
learn_step3_desc: Use @{} syntax to bind dynamic data to your UI components.
learn_advanced_subtitle: Master Include system, styles, localization, and more
learn_include_desc: Reuse layouts across your app with the Include component. Break large layouts into smaller, maintainable pieces.
learn_styles_desc: Define reusable styles in separate JSON files and apply them with the style attribute.
learn_localization_desc: Use string keys instead of hardcoded text to support multiple languages.
learn_collections_subtitle: Build dynamic lists and interactive forms
learn_collection_desc: Render dynamic lists by binding data arrays. Each item is rendered using the child template.
learn_form_desc: Build forms with TextField, Button, and other input components.
ref_subtitle: Complete documentation for JsonUI components and attributes
ref_components_desc: View, Label, Button, Image, TextField, and more
ref_attributes_desc: Size, color, font, padding, margin, and layout properties
ref_include_desc: Reuse JSON layouts with the Include component
ref_styles_desc: Define and apply reusable style templates
platforms_subtitle: JsonUI runs everywhere you need it
platforms_swift_features: UIKit & SwiftUI support, Hot reload, CocoaPods & SPM
platforms_kotlin_features: Compose & XML support, Hot reload, Maven & Gradle
platforms_react_features: React & Tailwind support, Hot reload, npm & yarn
preview_view_desc: Horizontal View with padding and background
installation_subtitle: Get started with JsonUI on your platform
quick_start_subtitle: Build your first JsonUI component in minutes
qs_swift_step1_desc: Use the CLI to create a new view with ViewModel and layout file.
qs_swift_step2_desc: Edit the generated JSON file to define your UI structure.
qs_swift_step3_desc: Generate Swift code and start hot reload for instant updates.
qs_kotlin_step1_desc: Use the CLI to create a new view with ViewModel and layout file.
qs_kotlin_step2_desc: Edit the generated JSON file to define your UI structure.
qs_kotlin_step3_desc: Generate Kotlin code and start hot reload for instant updates.
qs_react_step1_desc: Use the CLI to create a new view with ViewModel and layout file.
qs_react_step2_desc: Edit the generated JSON file to define your UI structure.
qs_react_step3_desc: Generate React components and start watch mode for instant updates.
styling_subtitle: Apply styles and create reusable themes
styling_inline_desc: Apply styles directly on components using attributes like background, padding, and fontSize.
styling_template_desc: Define reusable styles in separate JSON files and apply them with the style attribute.
data_binding_subtitle: Connect your UI to data sources dynamically
data_binding_basics_desc: Use @{} syntax to bind properties to your UI components.
data_binding_collections_desc: Bind arrays to Collection components to render dynamic lists.
comp_detail_uikit_support: • UIKit: Full support - Maps to SJUIView
comp_detail_compose_support: • Jetpack Compose: Full support - Maps to Box/Column/Row
comp_detail_android_xml_support: • Android XML: Maps to LinearLayout or ConstraintLayout
comp_detail_react_support: • React/Next.js: Full support - Maps to div with Tailwind CSS
comp_view_desc: The fundamental container component for building layouts. View acts as a flexible container that can hold other components and supports various layout configurations.
comp_label_desc: A text display component for showing static or dynamic text content. Supports rich text formatting, links, and partial text styling.
comp_label_uikit: • UIKit: Full support - Maps to SJUILabel
comp_label_compose: • Jetpack Compose: Full support - Maps to Text
comp_label_react: • React/Next.js: Full support - Maps to span with Tailwind CSS
comp_button_desc: An interactive button component that responds to user taps. Supports various styles and click handlers.
comp_button_uikit: • UIKit: Full support - Maps to SJUIButton
comp_button_compose: • Jetpack Compose: Full support - Maps to Button
comp_button_react: • React/Next.js: Full support - Maps to button with Tailwind CSS
comp_textfield_desc: A single-line text input component for user input. Supports placeholder text, keyboard types, and validation.
comp_textfield_uikit: • UIKit: Full support - Maps to SJUITextField
comp_textfield_compose: • Jetpack Compose: Full support - Maps to TextField
comp_textfield_react: • React/Next.js: Full support - Maps to input with Tailwind CSS
comp_textview_desc: A multi-line text input component for longer user input. Supports scrolling and dynamic height.
comp_textview_uikit: • UIKit: Full support - Maps to SJUITextView
comp_textview_compose: • Jetpack Compose: Full support - Maps to TextField with multiline
comp_textview_android_xml: • Android XML: Maps to KjuiEditText with multiline
comp_textview_react: • React/Next.js: Full support - Maps to textarea with Tailwind CSS
comp_switch_desc: A toggle switch component for boolean on/off states. Supports custom colors and change handlers.
comp_switch_uikit: • UIKit: Full support - Maps to SJUISwitch
comp_switch_compose: • Jetpack Compose: Full support - Maps to Switch
comp_slider_desc: A slider component for selecting values within a range. Supports min/max values and step increments.
comp_slider_uikit: • UIKit: Full support - Maps to SJUISlider
comp_slider_compose: • Jetpack Compose: Full support - Maps to Slider
comp_slider_react: • React/Next.js: Full support - Maps to input[type=range] with Tailwind CSS
comp_scrollview_desc: A scrollable container component for content that exceeds the viewport. Supports vertical and horizontal scrolling.
comp_scrollview_uikit: • UIKit: Full support - Maps to SJUIScrollView
comp_scrollview_compose: • Jetpack Compose: Full support - Maps to LazyColumn/LazyRow
comp_scrollview_react: • React/Next.js: Full support - Maps to div with overflow-auto
comp_collection_desc: A dynamic list component for rendering data arrays. Supports item templates, headers, and data binding.
comp_collection_uikit: • UIKit: Full support - Maps to SJUICollectionView
comp_collection_compose: • Jetpack Compose: Full support - Maps to LazyColumn
comp_collection_react: • React/Next.js: Full support - Maps to mapped array with Tailwind CSS
ref_components_overview_desc: JsonUI provides a rich set of components for building cross-platform user interfaces.
ref_view_overview: View is the fundamental container component for building layouts in JsonUI.
ref_attr_layout_desc: Layout attributes control how components are sized and positioned within their parent containers.
ref_attr_styling_desc: Styling attributes control the visual appearance of components.
ref_attr_typography_desc: Typography attributes control text rendering and formatting.
ref_data_binding_overview: Data binding connects your UI to dynamic data sources using the @{} syntax.
ref_binding_basic_desc: Use @{propertyName} to bind a component property to a ViewModel value.
ref_binding_nested_desc: Access nested properties with dot notation: @{user.name}
ref_binding_collections_desc: In collections, use @{item.property} to access item data.
ref_include_overview: The include system allows you to reuse JSON layouts across your application.
ref_styles_overview: Define reusable style templates to maintain consistent styling across your app.
ref_events_overview: Handle user interactions with event handlers bound to ViewModel methods.
ref_attributes_overview: Common attributes can be applied to most JsonUI components to control layout, styling, and behavior.
ref_attr_core_desc: Essential attributes for identifying and structuring components.
ref_attr_margins_desc: Margins and padding control the spacing around and within components.
ref_attr_alignment_desc: Alignment attributes control how components are positioned relative to their parent or sibling views.
ref_attr_interaction_desc: Interaction attributes control visibility, touch handling, and event responses.
ref_attr_zorder_desc: Z-order attributes control the stacking order of views.
attr_include_desc: Path to JSON file to include
attr_margins_desc: [top, right, bottom, left] or single value
attr_shadow_desc: Shadow config (color, offsetX, offsetY, opacity, radius)
attr_can_tap_desc: Enable tap capability for non-button views
ref_view_desc: The fundamental container component for building layouts. View acts as a flexible container that can hold other components and supports various layout configurations.
ref_view_attr_direction_desc: Child ordering direction: topToBottom, bottomToTop, leftToRight, rightToLeft
ref_view_attr_gravity_desc: Child alignment within the View: top, bottom, center, left, right
ref_view_attr_highlight_bg_desc: Background color when highlighted state is active
ref_view_attr_highlighted_desc: Whether the view is in highlighted state
ref_view_attr_cantap_desc: Enable tap capability for non-button views
ref_view_attr_tap_bg_desc: Background color when the view is tapped
ref_view_attr_onClick_desc: Closure-based click event handler using @{} syntax
ref_view_attr_shadow_desc: Shadow configuration object with color, offset, opacity, radius
ref_view_attr_cliptobounds_desc: Clip child content to view bounds
ref_view_attr_userinteraction_desc: Enable/disable user interaction on the view
ref_label_desc: A text display component for showing static or dynamic text content. Supports rich text formatting, links, and partial text styling.
ref_label_attr_text_desc: Text content to display (supports string keys for localization)
ref_label_attr_font_desc: Font name or family to use
ref_label_attr_fontweight_desc: Font weight: normal, bold, semibold, etc.
ref_label_attr_linebreak_desc: Line break mode: wordWrap, charWrap, clip, truncateHead, truncateTail, truncateMiddle
ref_button_desc: An interactive button component that responds to user taps. Supports various styles and click handlers.
ref_button_attr_enabled_desc: Whether the button is enabled (default: true)
ref_textfield_desc: A single-line text input component for user input. Supports placeholder text, keyboard types, and validation.
ref_textfield_attr_keyboardtype_desc: Keyboard type: default, email, number, phone, url
ref_textfield_attr_autocapitalize_desc: Capitalization mode: none, words, sentences, characters
ref_textview_desc: A multi-line text input component for longer user input. Supports scrolling and dynamic height.
ref_switch_desc: A toggle switch component for boolean on/off states. Supports custom colors and change handlers.
ref_slider_desc: A slider component for selecting values within a range. Supports min/max values and step increments.
ref_scrollview_desc: A scrollable container component for content that exceeds the viewport. Supports vertical and horizontal scrolling.
ref_collection_desc: A dynamic list component for rendering data arrays. Supports item templates, headers, and data binding.
